tool.name: GATE Named Entity Recognizer
tool.help:
**What it does**
Recognizes named entities in text, using GATE's `ANNIE Semantic Tagger <https://gate.ac.uk/sale/tao/split.html#QQ2-9-156>`_.
**Required Annotations**
* Tokens with `Penn part of speech tags <https://www.ling.upenn.edu/courses/Fall_2003/ling001/penn_treebank_pos.html>`_ in GATE XML format (will automatically convert from LIF) * Sentences in GATE XML format (will automatically convert from LIF) * "Lookup"" annotations generated with the tool *GATE->GATE Gazeteer*
**Generated Annotations**
The following annotation types and features, in `GATE XML format <https://gate.ac.uk/sale/tao/splitch5.html#x8-1000005.5.2>`_ :
* Person with feature *gender* = male, female, unknown * Location with feature *locType* = region, airport, city, country, county, province, other * Organization with feature *orgType* = company, department, government, newspaper, team, other * Money * Percent * Date with feature *kind* = date, time, dateTime * Address with feature *kind* = email, url, phone, postcode, complete, ip, other * IdentiÔ¨Åer * Unknown
.. class:: warningmark
The output of all GATE tools is in `GATE XML format <https://gate.ac.uk/sale/tao/splitch5.html#x8-1000005.5.2>`_. This output can be input directly into other GATE tools. To input GATE XML format to tools requiring LIF, use *Convert formats->GateToLif*
